title: Torah (JPSA) 01: Genesis
description:
The first book of the Pentateuch - Genesis. Presented according to weekly parshah.

Praised are You, Adonai, Our G-d, ruler of the Universe, who has made us holy with commandments and commanded us to engage in the study of Torah.
(Summary by Linette Geisel and traditional prayer) Parshat descriptions provided by Wikipedia.

sections.title: Parashat Bereishit, Genesis 1-6:8, Creation, Eden, Adam and Eve, Cain and Abel, Lamech, wickedness
Parashat Noach, Genesis 6:9-11:32, Noah’s Ark, the Flood, Noah’s drunkenness, the Tower of Babel
Parashat Lech-Lecha, Genesis 12:1-17:27, Abraham, Sarah, Lot, covenant, Hagar and Ishmael, circumcision
Parashat Vayeira, Genesis 18:1-22:24, Abraham's visitors, Sodomites, Lot’s visitors and flight, Hagar expelled, binding of Isaac
Parashat Chayei Sarah, Genesis 23:1-25:18, Sarah buried, Rebekah for Isaac
Parashat Toledot, Genesis 25:19-28:9, Esau and Jacob, Esau's birthright, Isaac’s blessing
Parashat Vayetze, Genesis 28:10-32:3, Jacob flees, Rachel, Leah, Laban, Jacob’s children and departure
Parashat Vayishlach, Genesis 32:4-36:43, Jacob’s reunion with Esau, the rape of Dinah
Parashat Vayeshev, Genesis 37:1-40:23 Joseph's dreams, coat, and slavery, Judah with Tamar, Joseph and Potiphar
Parashat Miketz, Genesis 41:1-44:17, Pharaoh’s dream, Joseph's in government, Joseph’s brothers visit Egypt
Parashat Vayigash, Genesis 44:18-47:27, Joseph reveals himself, Jacob moves to Egypt
Parashat Vayechi, Genesis 47:28-50:26, Jacob’s blessings, death of Jacob and of Joseph
